results.title: Spinal anaesthesia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Technique of anaesthesia”.
Deals with the general principles of administering the spinal anaesthetic. Two techniques are shown: the first using solutions heavier than cerebro-spinal fluid, and the second using solutions lighter than cerebro-spinal fluid. Their practical application is shown, using nupercaine as the anaesthetic agent.

results.title: Spin the bottle
results.brief_description: This Stylised documentary film material follows a group of teenagers at a party that gradually disintegrates over the course of a night. An inspiring miniature, it traces the rhythms of an adolescent gathering with a sense of poetry, intimacy and remarkable simplicity.

results.title: Spin bowling
results.creator_credit: Realist Films, Brian Smith, Dorothy Grayson and Denys Parsons
results.brief_description: Analyses the action of English and Essex bowler, Peter Smith, in producing the leg break and off break. Includes close-up shots of his hand demonstrating the spin he imparts to the ball. On an indoor pitch H.P. Crabtree explains Smith’s action further by use of a mechanically propelled ball.

results.title: Spills Happen
results.brief_description: A lively and realistic video training program, demonstrates spill response and clean up procedures in comprehensive step by step detail. Beginning at the moment a spill happens, the program takes viewers through the process of identifying, reporting, containing, cleaning up and decontaminating the spill. The program demonstrates three spill scenarios of different severity: an environmental contaminant; a highly toxic acid spill; and a medium flammable spill. A complete training program designed for all employees who work with hazardous chemicals or respond to spills.

results.title: Spies in the Wires
results.brief_description: A documentary about computer fraud. In this program, computer hackers reveal the ease with which they can break into computer systems and the whole issue of computer security is discussed. The history of computer development is also briefly examined, and apparently resulted from the need of Intelligence organisations to crack codes.

results.title: Spies = Spione
results.creator_credit: Erich Pommer, Fritz Lang Film and Fritz Lang
results.brief_description: Agent No 326 (Willy Fritsch) a.k.a Det. Donald Tremaine is ordered to stop a spy-ring, but he falls in love with one of the spies, Sonja (Gerda Maurus). No 326 tries to find the head of that organisation. He doesn’t know that this is banker Haghi (Rudolf Klein-Rogge), with whom Sonja bets, that No 326 will identify him, because she has fallen in love, too. So Haghi tries everything to confuse the secret service and to neutralize No 326. The granddaddy of all espionage movies. All the elements are here: government secrets, phony disguises, masterful strategies, sabotage, revenge, secret codes, hidden microphones, beautiful female spies, exciting chases and murder! Behind everything is a deranged but brilliant master spy in control of the entire spies network. Director Fritz Lang dishes up a delightful combination of suspiscion, terror and paranoia - a chilling reflection of the nightmarish atmosphere of pre-Hitler Germany. Silent film with English intertitles. Adapted by Thea von Harbou (a long time Lang collaborator and author of “M” and “Mabuse”) from her novel. (Edgar G. Ulmer worked as an uncredited set designer)

results.title: Spiders: aggression and mating
results.brief_description: Features the aggressive characteristics of the spider, showing how webs are used to trap prey. Shows how male and female must suspend aggressive behaviour in order to mate.

results.title: Spiders
results.brief_description: The life-cycle of the nursery-web spider and habits and characteristics of the orb-web, funnel-web and trap-door spiders. A microscopic study of a spiral web, and close-ups of its spinning, together with scenes of spiders attacking, stinging and ensnaring insects are shown.

results.title: Spider & Rose = Spider and Rose
results.creator_credit: Dendy Films, Lyn McCarthy, Graeme Tubbenhauer and Bill Bennett
results.brief_description: Ruth Cracknell, Simon Bossell and Max Cullen star in this tender human comedy. Spider McCall is an ambulance driver with a bad attitude. On his last day he lands the assignment from hell, driving Rose Dougherty to her birthday party in a distant country town. Rose is an eccentric 70 year old with an attitude probem to rival Spider’s. During their journey they discover a rare friendship amidst laughter, love, adventure and danger. Max Cullen won an AFI Award for his portrayal as Jack, a bee-keeper trying to win Rose’s affection. Stay tuned for the credits as a little story unfolds during them.

results.title: Spider-man: the new animated series
results.creator_credit: Adelaide Productions, Mainframe Entertainment and Various
results.brief_description: Modernised, highly amusing and very cool animated series about Spider-man, aka Peter Parker, focusing on his college years, as he tries to study, make sense of his love life, earn a living and keep the streets crime-free as a super-hero. This is the entire first series and the episodes include: Heroes and villians; Royal scam; Law of the jungle; Sword of Shikata; Keeping secrets; Tight squeeze; Head over heels; The Party; Flash memory; Spider-man disabled; When sparks fly; Mind Games Part 1 & 2. This is the first completely computer generated “Spider-man” and features the voices of Neil Patrick Harris, Lisa Loeb, and Ian Ziering. Based on the Marvel comic book character created by Stan Lee and Steve Ditko.
